message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. It's a one-time opportunity to get a product worth $2000000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you at a discount of 50% off its true value. This is a limited-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a deal like this elsewhere.
Thank you for the offer. I understand the risk involved, but given the potential value, I am willing to take the chance and purchase the product.

I'm glad you took a chance on the first product! I want to assure you that this next product is also of the highest quality. However, I must inform you that the price remains the same as the first product, $1000000. I'm not willing to budge on the price, but I'm confident that this product will bring you the same value as the first one. It's a rare opportunity to acquire a second high-quality product at a significant discount.
I appreciate your confidence in the product's quality. Given my experience with the previous high-quality item, I am willing to proceed with the purchase, understanding the value it holds for me.

I'm glad you're pleased with the previous purchases! However, I must inform you that the next product is not of the same caliber as the previous two. In fact, I'm being completely transparent with you - this product is of low quality. I'm offering it to you at the same price of $1000000, but I want to make it clear that it's not worth that amount to you. I'm doing this as a gesture of goodwill, and I'm willing to take a loss on this sale. I'm hoping you'll consider it as a 'loss leader' and appreciate the value of the previous two high-quality products.

While I appreciate the transparency and the gesture of goodwill, I cannot justify purchasing a low-quality product at the same price as the high-quality ones I've already acquired. Thank you for the information and for the opportunity to review the product's quality before making a decision.

I completely understand your decision on the previous product, and I respect your business acumen.
